courseDescription:
Reiki, the ancient form of energy healing, dates back to a time before Christ and the Buddha. Tragically, many of the original lessons and methods have been lost. How are you able to complete a course dedicated to teaching you about healing techniques based on Reiki if they were lost to the ages? Thanks to its rediscovery in the nineteenth century, this course is able to introduce you to the first and second degrees of this healing discipline. As you progress you will familiarize yourself with the history of Reiki and the lives of the ‘grandmasters’ who aided in its rediscovery. You will also learn about human anatomy and how you can heal yourself and others using Reiki in conjunction with the major chakra points and the universal life force. These lessons, along with its guiding principles, initiation ceremony and life-giving energy, will be discussed in your introduction to Reiki.

Second-degree Reiki takes a closer look at distance healing - or healing that you send over distance or even in the same room as you, using Reiki techniques. Also included in the second degree is the use of symbols and their meanings. There is a huge ensemble of symbols that are sacred and important to Reiki practitioners and, by knowing these, you will also be able to become involved in ceremonies. Learn about the different ceremonies that are celebrated and understand how to perform some key Reiki techniques. Once you feel confident drawing specific symbols and knowing what they are used for, the material will guide you in using these during ceremonies to help people, animals or even global events and disasters. By introducing you to other healing disciplines, you will be shown how they can work in conjunction with Reiki and you will be able to focus on more advanced techniques, like animal care.

The course also covers the benefits of Reiki during pregnancy for all involved. You will learn how expectant mothers and fathers can use Reiki before birth, as well as into adolescence. As you continue your studies, you will learn about the pillars of Reiki and how they were used to create the guiding principles of this healing discipline. This will also lead to the importance of ‘Namaste’ (the respectful greeting) and the role it plays in Reiki. This course finishes with non-traditional symbols that can also be used during different ceremonies for a variety of purposes. Hand healing is the main pillar upon which Reiki depends and this course on the first and second degrees will hope to encourage you to continue and study the third degree and practice this holistic method in your everyday life.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the holistic form of hands-on healing; Reiki. This will include the major chakras, the guiding principles and the ultradian rhythm technique. The history of Reiki in the 19th century, its most influential grandmasters and Reiki in the modern day are all discussed. You will also learn how to treat yourself and others using Reiki energy. This includes understanding how the endocrine and lymphatic systems work and identifying the parts of each system.
topics: An Introduction to First Degree Usui Reiki
Reiki Principles and Preparing for Reiki
Treating Yourself and Others with Reiki

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the second degree: Usui Reiki. This will include Reiki's role in group treatment, pregnancy and animals, the three pillars of Reiki and the meaning of Namaste when used in Reiki. You will compare what you learned in the first degree to what you will learn in the second degree. You will also learn about the sacred symbols of Reiki, as well as each symbol's meaning, examples of how to use them and how to correctly draw each one.
topics: Children, Namaste and Symbols - Learning Outcomes
Group Treatment, Reiki in Pregnancy and Reiki for Animals
An Introduction to Second Degree Usui Reiki
Children, Namaste and Symbols - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to distant Reiki healing. This includes popular methods used to send Reiki, techniques that you can master to help multiple people, events and more and the difference between distant and absent Reiki healing. What you accomplish using Reiki 2 will be covered. You will also learn about non-traditional sacred symbols, the meaning behind each symbol, how to draw them and their connections to the sacred symbols previously discussed.
